intro: Fumaria major, commonly known as greater celandine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its sap contains alkaloids and has been used historically in traditional medicine. However, it is considered toxic and should be handled with care.
